perturbation.original_text: You will maintain during the term of this Agreement, and preserve for the time period specified by us, full, complete, and accurate books, records, and accounts in accordance with the standard accounting system prescribed by us from time to time in writing.  You will retain for a period of three (3) years all books and records related to the Franchised Restaurant, including without limitation, sales checks, purchase orders, invoices, payroll records, customer lists, check stubs, sales tax records and returns, cash receipts and disbursement journals and general ledgers.
perturbation.changed_text: You will maintain during the term of this Agreement, and preserve for the time period specified by us, full, complete, and accurate books, records, and accounts in accordance with the standard accounting system prescribed by us from time to time in writing. You will retain for the duration of this Agreement all business documents related to the Franchised Restaurant, including without limitation, sales checks, purchase orders, invoices, payroll records, customer lists, check stubs, sales tax records and returns, cash receipts and disbursement journals and general ledgers.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a retention period of 'three (3) years', while the modified text states retention 'for the duration of this Agreement'. This creates an internal contradiction regarding how long the franchisee is legally obligated to keep these records. It also replaces the term books and records with business documents which is vagues and broadens the scope of documents to be retained.

perturbation.original_text: The Franchised Restaurant shall at all times be under your direct, on-premises supervision, unless, upon sixty (60) days prior written notice and approval by us you designate a trained and competent employee to act as full-time general manager.  Your designation of a general manager shall be subject to our prior written approval, and shall further be subject to the designated general manager successfully completing our training course.  All costs for the attendance of the designated general manager at our training course shall be at your cost, except as set forth in Section IV(A).  We will have the right at any time to revoke our approval of a designated manager.  The use of a general manager will in no way relieve you of your obligations to observe, perform and comply with this Agreement and the Manuals and to insure that the Franchised Restaurant is properly managed and operated or the responsibility for the on-site, day to day operation of the Franchised Restaurant.
perturbation.changed_text: The Franchised Restaurant shall at all times be under your direct, on-premises supervision, unless, upon sixty (60) days prior written notice and approval by us you designate a trained and competent staff member to act as full-time supervisor.  Your designation of a supervisor shall be subject to our prior written approval, and shall further be subject to the designated supervisor successfully completing our training course.  All costs for the attendance of the designated supervisor at our training course shall be at your cost, except as set forth in Section IV(A).  We will have the right at any time to revoke our approval of a designated supervisor.  The use of a supervisor will relieve you of certain obligations to observe, perform and comply with this Agreement and the Manuals and to ensure that the Franchised Restaurant is properly managed and operated and the responsibility for the on-site, day to day operation of the Franchised Restaurant.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text replaces 'general manager' with 'supervisor,' implying different roles. However, the contradiction arises when the original text states that using a 'general manager' does NOT relieve the franchisee of their obligations, while the modified text states that a 'supervisor' WILL relieve them of certain obligations, creating a conflict.
perturbation.location: XII. STANDARDS OF QUALITY AND PERFORMANCE

perturbation.original_text: We may from time to time advise or offer guidance to you relative to prices for the food and other products offered for sale by the Franchised Restaurant that in our judgment constitute good business practice.  Such guidance will be based on our experience in operating and franchising Restaurants and an analysis of the costs of such products and prices charged for competitive products.  You will not be obligated to accept any such advice or guidance and shall have the sole right to determine the prices to be charged from time to time by the Franchised Restaurant and no such advice or guidance shall be deemed or construed to impose upon you any obligation to charge any fixed, minimum or maximum prices for any product offered for sale by the Franchised Restaurant.  We may from time to time establish promotional practices which you are required to follow such as "free refill," "buy one and get one free" or similar practices.
perturbation.changed_text: We may from time to time advise or offer directives to you relative to prices for the food and other products offered for sale by the Franchised Restaurant that in our judgment constitute good business practice.  Such directives will be based on our experience in operating and franchising Restaurants and an analysis of the costs of such products and prices charged for competitive products.  You will be obligated to accept such directives and do not have the sole right to determine the prices to be charged from time to time by the Franchised Restaurant, and such advice or guidance shall be deemed or construed to impose upon you an obligation to charge fixed prices for products offered for sale by the Franchised Restaurant.  We may from time to time establish promotional practices which you are required to follow such as "free refill," "buy one and get one free" or similar practices.
perturbation.explanation: In the original text, the franchisee is not obligated to follow the franchisor's pricing advice. In the modified text, the franchisee is obligated and does not have sole rights. This creates direct conflict in pricing rights/responsibilities.
